intro: Pouchetia gilletii, commonly known as the Hawaiian ironwood, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its dense, woody structure and small, showy flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are clustered in inflorescences. Pouchetia gilletii is well adapted to the dry, coastal environments of Hawaii, where it plays an important ecological role.
